--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> Is it reasonable to say that the Sarga gave Owlhawk a
> psycic shield to keep him from being paralyzed or
> controled?  Speaking of him did Winged Warrior ever
> respond to my last post for him?
> 
> --- Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > All right in response to the new powers of Empath,
> > the council has felt it 
> > necessary to regulate telepathy for the first time. 
> > (And before you get 
> > offended Cardhead, no we're not concerned about you
> > abusing these powers. 
> > It's people with less self control making similar
> > characters and abusing 
> > these powers that we're worried about.)
> > 
> > 1) Telepathy requires a great deal of energon and
> > thus may not be used 
> > repeatedly or for very long. i.e. you may not
> > paralyze multiple bots at once 
> > or keep one paralyzed for an indefinite amount of
> > time.
> > 
> > 2) Telepathy may not be used very often.  i.e. you
> > may not paralyze a bot 
> > then move on to another bot without recharging for a
> > time.
> > 
> > 3) No direct harm of another bot without expressed
> > consent.  Someone on the 
> > council must receive a notice from the victim sent
> > before the post where said 
> > harm is to occur.  Note: This does not apply if you
> > are harming another of 
> > your characters.
> > 
> > 4) Whomever shall use telepathy to paralyze must
> > accept any reasonable 
> > attempt to escape said telepathy.  Note:  "He was
> > paralyzed but shook it 
> > off." is not a reasonable attempt.  Put some thought
> > into it.
> > 
> > 5) ANY new telepaths with the ability to influence
> > others through their 
> > thoughts must be approved by the council.  This
> > includes any upgraded by Soul 
> > Orbs.  There must be a plausible reason for them to
> > have this kind of power 
> > before they will be approved.  (Soul Orbs are one
> > such reason.)
> > 
> > Thank you for your time.  Any questions, comments,
> > complaints, concerns, 
> > insults, etc., should be addressed to the council
> > not the group as a whole.
> > 
> 
>
